name: Federal Income Tax
description:
This is a re-write of the federal income tax. It primarily does the following:
Article 2 - Tax Accounting - Moves a large number of personal credits to the tax accounting system
Article 3 - Hourly Tax Amount - Computes and records in the Tax Payment account the hourly tax amount. This occurs 1 trigger prior to tax collection.
Article 4 - Effective Tax Rate - Computes and records the effective tax rate for statistical purposes. This is 1 trigger delayed from Article 3 and at the same time as the tax collection.
Article 5 - Automatic Tax Payment - Collects the tax amount from Article 3 every hour. It is delayed 1 trigger behind Article 3.
Article 6 - Manual Tax Payment - Allows for the manual tax payment over the next 48 hours. Automatically refunds overpayments.
Article 7 - Tax Projection - Projects the next 48 hours in owed taxes. Updates hourly. Provides automatic refunds if manual payments were made and expected taxes go down.
Article 8 - Account Protections - Prevents moving of tax currencies or altering the tax related accounts
Article 9 - Tax Statistical Commands - !tax and !rate commands have been updated to include additional information
Article 10 - Taxable Income - Computes and records the taxable income for statistical purposes. This records at the same time as Article 3 (1 trigger ahead of tax collection).

Tax Owed = projected taxes over the next 48 hours reflected in your wallet (or company legal person's wallet).
Tax Receipts = receipt for advance payment of taxes owed. This is collected during automatic tax payments in lieu of euros if you have paid your tax bill in advance.

properties.Title: Tax Accounting
properties.UserDescription: This section pulls a large amount of personal credits into the federal tax accounting system to prevent and/or reduce spam on the personal wallets. It must target the largest group of people to ensure that the tax accounting system has personal currency prior to the tax amount registering otherwise the later transfer sections cannot complete.

properties.Title: Hourly Tax Amount
properties.UserDescription:
This records the tax payment amount in the tax payment account in the personal currency. This should increase visibility of tax amounts, but come at a small delay offset by 1 hour.

Uses transfer trigger to reduce spam in personal wallets. Smart transfer is not available to/from government accounts.

Implementation Notes: expense stat does not properly account for company count of non-abandoned employees. It treats companys as the same as regular citizens for UBI subtraction. See comments in tax command notes.

properties.Title: Manual Tax Payment
properties.UserDescription: This section allows for manual tax payments of already owed taxes to allow more manual control over when taxes come out of your account. As long as you have owed taxes, you can pay up to the balance of the taxes owed and receive tax receipts. The receipts will be drawn back to the tax accounting account in lieu of euros when the normal tax ticks. This is a pay-in-advance type style. You cannot pay the treasury if you do not owe any taxes. Any overpayments are refunded automatically.

properties.DisplayText: You have no taxes due and donations are prohibited.

properties.Title: Tax Projection
properties.UserDescription: This section provides an estimated tax projection of owed taxes over the next 48 hours. This projection updates hourly and accounts for any manual tax payments made. If tax amount owed to the federal treasury is less than total tax receipts held by the taxpayer, then a refund for the difference is automatically issued.

properties.DisplayText: Tax specific currencies and accounts are not to be traded or moved.

properties.Title: Tax Statistic Command
properties.UserDescription:
Improved the !rate and added !tax command to improve visibility of metrics associated with the tax. 

Implementation Notes: Company UBI subtraction from expenses needs to account for non-abandoned employees. A possible way to control this is with custom stats recorded to the legal person such that when joining the company -> Add +1, when leaving or being removed from the company (rare) -> Subtract 1. When entering the abandoned demographic -> subtract 1, when leaving the abandoned demographic -> add 1. This should really be in at the start of the cycle. I'm not super sure how to best implement mid-cycle.

properties.Title: Taxable Income
properties.UserDescription: This section calculates the taxable income that the tax brackets are applied for the purposes of greater visibility. This is section is not used in the actual tax payment chain. It could however be substituted into the tax bracket section, but that would make the tax collection 2 hours behind recording by putting it behind 2 additional triggers.
